This game is pretty much the online version of communism. If there is any aspect of the game that takes thought process, skill, or has any aspect where one player can be better at using it than another by constantly practicing, the devs will rework it. They will change that aspect of the game so that it no longer takes skill so that everyone is equal. No one is better than another.
Their fix to everything is to just slap a timer on it and call it a day. Sabo takes planning, coordination, and prediction to be able to consistently pull off? ADD A COOLDOWN! Billy is the most balanced killer in the game? ADD A COOLDOWN!

If they aren't adding cooldowns to something that no one gave a fuck about in the first place, they are busy coming up with new changes that they will release on PTB, receive negative feedback on, and then release it anyways with no changes.
Here is an example of how a BVHR meeting goes when discussing what to do with their game next:

Community: "Hitboxes don't work."
BVHR: "LETS CHANGE THE MOVEMENT OF SURVIVORS SO THAT THEY LOOK LIKE UNCOOKED SPAGHETTI NOODLES!"
Community: "Matchmaking sucks, the ranking system sucks."
BVHR: "WE NEED BETTER GRAPHICS!"
Community: "There aren't enough objectives in the game or things to do besides gens."
BVHR: "I HAVE A NEW KILLER IDEA! IT'S CALLED THE BOT, IT TAKES NO SKILL TO PLAY AND GOES AGAINST ANYTHING SKILLFUL A SURVIVOR CAN DO!"
Community: "Some of these perks really need a rework."
BVHR: "WE NEED MORE BREAKABLE WALLS!"

Maybe instead, we should donate to the cause of helping blind and deaf patients, since they clearly can't read or listen to any of the feedback that any member of the community has ever provided. The next update, they will probably start rationing out 400,000 bloodpoints and 1,000 shards for the season for each player since they seem to be turning their game into Venezuela's communist party. The only thing they got right is that this is a horror game, but only because the dev's lack of intelligence is actually terrifying.

Ever since the plague update there has been....
Unbalanced games (im level 19 placed against level 15s and lower with maxed stats)
Laggy servers

I have played this game for a long time, and to be honest... it hasn't gotten much better.
The game is super fun to play, and even more fun with friends. But the dev team needs to get their act together and stop putting patches that buff the game in. I won't want my killer to be more powerful just so the survivors complain and then THEY get more powerful, it's a vicious cycle and only a few killers have stayed in it.
Overall the game can be a lot of fun, until you've played long enough to rank past 10 or so, then you're fun is over. The game turns into a slug fest of toxicity and sweat.
I will give the game props for creativity and design though, that's your best in my opinion, devs.

I've been really patient with the devs for a long time. By a long time I mean about 18 months.

I've been excited for new killers along with the chance for them to actually balance things out and sort out things like bugs that haven't been fixed yet along with chronic issues that the devs just refuse to sort out.

As it turns out, I've pretty much lost 1.2k hours of my life in absolute vain.

I'm a killer main, so my problems are coming from this point of view.

Let's go over the main issues with the game. Looping, genrush and body block.

First off, looping. We've all been there. We all got someone running around the pallet to waste the killers time. With windows, it's a much bigger issue than pallets, since you can just destroy those, and there are perks/addons to sort them out quickly. Windows can't be destroyed, and they REALLY cause a gap between the killer and survivor. And the survivors abuse the life out of them and NOTHING can be done to sort it out. Now you could say: "Use legion, use nurse, use bamboozle." Well there's a problem there. Legion can only help with their power, and they can't even down survivors most of the time with frenzy, the survivors would have to be braindead to stick around. Nurse is a VERY difficult killer to play. She's slow, her power's difficult, and obviously most people are terrible with her. Bamboozle only blocks one window at a time. The extra speed helps but otherwise not by much.

Now let's get to my favourite part. Genrush. Holy bajeebus is it BAD!
For those who don't already know what it is, it's when survivors complete generators quickly to a point where it's out of your control. Yeah, there are perks to slow the game down, but every single one of them has a problem. Hex: Ruin makes skill checks reverse generator progress unless you get a great skill check. Unfortunately it can be cleansed and rendered useless. Pop goes the weasel is a perk that gets rid of a large chunk of generator progress. The problem with it is you need to hook somebody for a work, and you only have 30 seconds to use it. And given the problem I mentioned with looping, it's become rare to use. Thanatophobia slows every survivor action down depending on how many survivors are injured. Unfortunately the slowdown is negligable and it can be countered by healing. The only perk that is some level of use to stop this is overcharge, however survivors are able to avoid it by hitting the skill check.

Now for a not-so-serious issue. Body blocking. The name says it all. Thanks to the introduction of mad grit, it's not an issue with carrying someone anymore. However it's most often used when the exists are used. This makes getting that one chance for a kill should everything go to hell, WHICH IT OFTEN DOES, impossible.

With all these issues, the devs "solutions" do almost nothing to sort this out. They introduce perks that only slightly help, however given survivor behavior, ends up worthless.

With all this taken into account, I'm done with this game. Survivor has just gotten repetitive and boring, and killer has just gotten frustrating and feels more like a chore.

I used to love ya game, but it seems like you're a lost cause now. 

I'll probably drop by and play it again every now and then, but I'm highly unlikely to play killer.

Big edit here: Killer isn't as much of a chore anymore. But this game has now gone from unbalanced, to close to unplayable.

Dedicated servers have been out recently, after delays after delays after tests and what not... and it's a disaster.
Since ghost face, lobby times have now been taking an eternity. I've had times where I'd literally sit for half an hour without a match even being found.
Since hallowed catalyst, my connection to the game has descended in to downright AWFUL! On both ends, survivor and killer, randoms, friends and I have been rubberbanding about the map like crazy. There are times where survivors would walk in 1 line/get stuck and it'd be an easy downing... before disappearing off to the other side of the map. There are times where I can't even break a pallet or generator, there are times where the killer would vanish before my god damn eyes mid chase, I could go on and on and on.

Devs, just scrap the dedicated servers entirely, it's a disaster and you people do not have a very good history at fixing your game. Just go back to the killer being the host.
Yeah, listen entitled survivor brats, it's not me cheating. I'm not a lagswitcher and no, it's not my connection. You know damn well that it's the potato dedicated servers.

I have nearly 1,000 hours and was once near the top of the game. I had a review for this before, and the game has changed and made it irrelevant.

I do not recommend Dead by Daylight. This is rare, but the developers have over-developed this game. I love that they have passion for the game and are constantly trying to add new things. But this is not a game for people who play other games. I'm a member of the old guard. I've had this game for a long time and I've seen the game, the meta, everything change. Some of the changes were very good, some, not so much. But what's finally killed off my want to play this game is the constant additions. It seems like every month there's a new killer and survivor, to the point where I have no idea what's going on in the game anymore. There are too many killers, many of whom are too similar to each other. There's too many survivor perks, you can only take four and it feels like there's 400 to choose from.

I don't play because I don't know what's happening in the games that I'm playing. And I don't know what's happening because I don't play. It's a vicious cycle and I feel like the developers need to take a long break and slow things down. It used to be one of my favorite games, one of the ones I played the most. I'm still "good" at it. But I don't have the time to learn who every killer is, what their perks are, what their primary and secondary powers are, and how to counter them. It was difficult enough when Oni was the newest killer.

My point is, there's no way to casually play this game. You either have to devote a ton of time to learning everything and staying up to date with it, or you're going to get tilted because you have no idea how everything works. It's a shame.

1k hours in and I still love this game.... yes it gets so frustrating that I want to punch my screen... but that's the point. It still brings out emotion in me. How many other games can still do that after many years of play?
You will encounter toxic opponents... but that is because people are idiots (you can't blame a game for that!).
There ARE many bugs.... but I don't mind that, it makes things interesting and occasionally funny so who cares!?!
You will have bad games... you will have good games... sometimes you will play like potato... sometimes you will play like a god. That's why I keep coming back!
BUY THIS GAME.... and I will see you in the fog!
